settings.heading: What materials can I carve?
settings.row_content: Your X-Carve Pro can carve plywood, hardwoods, softwoods, and MDF. It can carve plastics, including HDPE, Delrin®️, polycarbonate, acrylic, and Corian®️.* It can also carve Non-ferrous metals, including aluminum, brass, copper, etc. For optimal results in aluminum and non-ferrous metals, lubrication and tools specifically designed for metals are required. *In order to achieve optimal results when carving, proper cut settings and chip removal are required. Inventables continues to test and refine cut settings for materials and will provide updated recommendations in Easel when available.

settings.heading: Can I carve metal with it?
settings.row_content: You can carve aluminum and other non-ferrous metals. For optimal results in aluminum and non-ferrous metals, lubrication and tools specifically designed for metals are required.

settings.heading: How is the spindle cooled?
settings.row_content: The spindle is air-cooled for easy setup and use.

settings.heading: Can I attach a laser?
settings.row_content: We do not have any plans down the line to support anything besides a router head for X-Carve Pro. This is for both safety reasons and our inability to offer quality software for these applications. There are some people making these modifications to their machines but they are considered unsupported upgrades, are not covered by and will likely void the 1-year limited warranty that comes with X-Carve Pro.

settings.heading: Is there an expander kit to turn my X-Carve to X-Carve Pro?
settings.row_content: The X-Carve and X-Carve Pro are two very different CNC machines. The X-Carve uses a router and belt drive system, while the X-Carve Pro has an included spindle and uses ball screws and linear guides. While it’s not possible to expand your X-Carve to an X-Carve Pro, many customers are looking forward to running both machines out of their shop.

settings.heading: Is there an expander kit to turn my 4x2 to 4x4?
settings.row_content: We currently do not offer an expander kit to turn your 4x2 into a 4x4.

settings.heading: Can I use my own spindle?
settings.row_content: We do not recommend or support the use of your own spindle. The included 2hp (1.5Kw) spindle arrives ready to work with pre-programmed VFD (variable frequency drive).

settings.heading: What is the maximum size material that can be carved (length, width, thickness)?
settings.row_content: The maximum size material that can be carved is infinite feet long, 4ft wide, and 4 inches thick.

settings.heading: What is the weight of the X-Carve Pro?
settings.row_content: Approximately 300lbs for the 4x4 and approximately 275lbs for the 4x2.

settings.heading: What is the footprint of the X-Carve Pro?
settings.row_content: The footprint for the 4x4 model is 65.75in x 55.75in x 25in and the footprint for the 4x2 model is 65.75in x 31.6in x 25in.

settings.heading: Hardware
Can I test out Easel Pro before purchasing the X-Carve Pro?
settings.row_content: With 3 years of Easel Pro included in your X-Carve Pro bundle, you’ll have plenty of time to get to know our intuitive drag-and-drop software. But if you’d like some extra time to see how easy it is to use, you can sign up for a free 30-day trial of Easel Pro here.

settings.heading: Can I import files from another program?
settings.row_content: Yes, as long as your program can export standard G-Code, SVG, or DXF files, the X-Carve Pro will work with other CAD/CAM software options.

settings.heading: Can I run Easel Pro on multiple machines?
settings.row_content: Yes, and with our new Machine Profiles feature, you can move your computer from machine to machine.

settings.heading: Do I need Internet access to use Easel and X-Carve Pro?
settings.row_content: Internet access is required to load and save Easel projects. Internet access is not required to work with a project once loaded or to connect to your machine and carve a project. If you do make changes to an Easel project while working offline, you will need to re-connect to the Internet to save them before closing the tab/window that the project is running in.

settings.heading: Will I be automatically billed after my 3-year upgrade to Easel Pro runs out?
settings.row_content: No, you will not be automatically billed. Instead, we will send you a reminder so you can update your payment method and avoid disrupting your subscription.

settings.heading: What happens to my Easel Pro account after 3 years?
settings.row_content: When your 3 years of included Easel Pro runs out, you will need to have a valid payment method stored on your account for it to renew. Otherwise, your account will become an Easel Free account. We do not delete or destroy any projects, so if that happens (accidentally or on purpose), you'll just need to enter a valid payment method to be restored to an Easel Pro experience again.

settings.heading: Are there any pre-loaded projects?
settings.row_content: We have many Easel files available on ourProjects Page and will be adding more X-Carve Pro projects as we get closer to the arrival of your X-Carve Pro.

settings.heading: When will the new Easel Pro features be available?
settings.row_content: We will be rolling out these features as soon as they’re available. We project that it will be no later than when we start shipping X-Carve Pros to customers.

settings.heading: Software
How will the X-Carve Pro be delivered?
settings.row_content: It will ship via LTL freight in several boxes on a pallet with lift gate service included through our carrier. The size of the pallet is estimated around 72" x 48" x 50".

settings.heading: How much will shipping cost?
settings.row_content: Shipping is included for all US addresses, including Alaska, Hawaii, US territories and military bases.

settings.heading: What size workbench do you recommend for the machine?
settings.row_content: We recommend 6’x6’ for the 4x4 and 6’x3’ for the 4x2.

settings.heading: What is included with my X-Carve Pro order?
settings.row_content: Your X-Carve Pro bundle includes 3 years of Easel Pro, 1 year limited warranty, controller, external controller (with start, stop, pause buttons), dust control system (hose, shoe, and arm), Z-probe, clamp sets (2), a planing bit, a ¼” high-speed steel 2 flute upcut spiral bit, a ¼” shank V-bit, and assembly tools (4ft level, allen key set, torque wrench, metric hex bit set, metric socket set, 17mm wrench, square).

settings.heading: How long does it take to assemble the X-Carve Pro?
settings.row_content: It takes less than 2 hours to assemble the X-Carve Pro.

settings.heading: Shipping & Setup
I need a different payment method (purchase order, split payments, physical check, etc.). What other options do you offer?
settings.row_content: If you are unable to use one of the existing payment methods (either by credit card or Affirm financing) for pre-ordering X-Carve Pro, please contact help@inventables and we may be able to accommodate other payment methods on a case-by-case basis.

settings.heading: What if I order and need to cancel?
settings.row_content: To cancel your order, please contact our Customer Success Department at (312) 775-7009 (Monday-Friday, 9am-5pmCST) or email us at help@inventables.com.

settings.heading: Do you offer discounts for purchasing multiple X-Carve Pros?
settings.row_content: If you are interested in purchasing multiple X-Carve Pros, please contact help@inventables.com and we will do our best to work with you on pricing.

settings.heading: When will my credit card be billed?
settings.row_content: Your credit card will be billed once you place your order.

settings.heading: When will I be billed if I'm paying through Affirm?
settings.row_content: If you finance your X-Carve Pro with Affirm, your first monthly payment is due approximately one month after your order is shipped.

settings.heading: Where can this be shipped?
settings.row_content: We are currently only shipping to US addresses, including US territories and military bases.

settings.heading: Could I add an extended warranty later?
settings.row_content: You will be able to add an extended warranty up to 10 months from the date of delivery of your X-Carve Pro. We will be launching a 3 year extended warranty option prior to beginning to ship X-Carve Pro and will notify all customers once it becomes available.

settings.heading: Billing
